subject: RE: Eugene PD x Flock - procurement next steps
body:
Good afternoon Caroline,
 
We have reviewed the proposed edits from Flock and provided redline responses in the attached contract draft documents for your legal team to review. 
 
To summarize the feedback we received broadly, the City Attorney advised that the Flock MSA remain as an attachment instead of being integrated directly in the City agreement language. Certain sections of the MSA, including payments terms from 6.1 and termination relating to Hardware in 7.2 were integrated directly since they corresponded with sections in the City�s agreement.
 
Additional changes:
*	The City cannot accept the request for lower insurance thresholds, as our requirements are driven by the Oregon Tort Act, vendors generally use an Umbrella policy to bridge any coverage gaps
*	FLOCK  MSA to be added as Exhibit D, not directly integrated into City Agreement language
*	Exhibit B Scope � still waiting on final scope of work to be agreed upon between Flock/EPD
*	Exhibit C Compensation Schedule � awaiting final quote/scope
*	 
 
 
 
From: Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com> 
Sent: Thursday, February 6, 2025 5:24 PM
To: COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov>
Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov>; CHOTERUNGRUANGKORN Nikki <NChoterungruangkorn@eugene-or.gov>
Subject: Re: Eugene PD x Flock - procurement next steps
 
[EXTERNAL ?]
Hi Tim,
 
Wanted to check in and see if your legal team is still working through the contract review?
	
 
Caroline Fraher
Regional Account Executive II

 https://www.instagram.com/flocksafety/

	Thank you Caroline, our procurement and legal teams are reviewing the proposed edits. I�ll follow up as soon as I have their collective responses. We appreciate the quick response from Flock in reviewing the terms!
	
	Best regards,

	Eugene Police Department

	Eugene, Oregon 97401

	Cell: (541) 844-9015

	Subject: Re: Eugene PD x Flock - procurement next steps
	 
	[EXTERNAL ?]
	Hi Tim,
	 
	I have attached my legal team's review. They have a few comments. 
	 
	We are more than happy to hop on a call with your legal department, too, if that would be helpful. Thanks!
	 
	 
	
 
Caroline Fraher

		 <https://sales.flocksafety.com/t/102869/open/53437d8a-d88e-42c7-9dde-6796a16e4369.gif> 
		 
		On Fri, Jan 24, 2025 at 9:33?AM COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov TCostin@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
			Good morning Caroline,
			 
			Thank you for sending over Flock�s legal docs for review, we will run these through our Attorney. Please see the attached draft agreement which includes the City of Eugene�s standard agreement and terms for the purchase of software services. Please note Exhibit A includes the City�s Standard Contract Provision and any proposed edits to that section would require attorney approval. 
			 
			We utilize a similar process, so please include proposed edits via Microsoft Word Track Changes.
			 
			If you have any questions during review, please reach out to me and I�ll connect you with the right party to answer the questions. I have included my colleague Nikki Choterungruangkorn as well, who supports our team with contract administration. 
			 
			Best,
			 
			Tim Costin
			Sr. Financial Analyst
			Eugene Police Department
			300 Country Club Road
			Eugene, Oregon 97401
			Office: (541) 682-8364
			Cell: (541) 844-9015
			 
			
			 
			From: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov > 
			Sent: Thursday, January 23, 2025 7:47 PM
			To: Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >; COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov TCostin@eugene-or.gov >
			Subject: Re: Eugene PD x Flock - procurement next steps
			 
			Tim and Caroline, 
			 
			I have reached out to Chief Skinner about the council question.  He confirmed there is no need to present to council in order to gain purchase approval.  
			 
			Get Outlook for iOS https://aka.ms/o0ukef 
			
________________________________

			From: Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >
			Sent: Thursday, January 23, 2025 11:20:55 AM
			To: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >; COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov TCostin@eugene-or.gov >
			Subject: Eugene PD x Flock - procurement next steps 
			 
			[EXTERNAL ?]
			Hi Capt Burke and Tim,
			 
			Thanks again for the time today. I am glad we are aligned on the rest of the procurement process.
			 
			To summarize, here are everyone's homework assignments:
			 
			Tim - Tim to send Caroline the City's standard T&C for review. Caroline and Tim to work through the legal review process with Flocks legal and Eugene's CA.
			 
			Captain Burke - Capt Burke to confirm with Chief if council approval is needed -  if so, ideally 2/24, 3/10, or 3/24 council date to get on agenda. Introduce Caroline to IT to confirm they have all necessary documents/questions answered. 
			 
			Caroline- 
			I have attached Flock's legal documents for your attorney's review:
			*	Order Form Exhibit A. This document outlines the products, payment terms, subscription term length, etc. This is the doc that will eventually be signed. We will update the term length and # of products as Caroline and Capt Burke finalize the deployment map.
			*	Exhibit B- Master Services Agreement (MSA). This is terms and conditions that will need to be approved by your attorney. Flock's legal team is easy to work with on comments/redlines, but they do request that all comments are made via Microsoft Word Track Changes.
			*	Exhibit C - Customer Implementation Guide. This is the guide to installation, no review of signatures needed on this
			Thank you again! Please don't hesitate to give me a shout at any time. 
	
 https://sales.flocksafety.com/t/102869/sc/c5ffb8fb-ac20-4583-9173--com 
Caroline Fraher
Territory Sales Manager

thread_messages.body:
Good afternoon Caroline,
 
We have reviewed the proposed edits from Flock and provided redline responses in the attached contract draft documents for your legal team to review. 
 
To summarize the feedback we received broadly, the City Attorney advised that the Flock MSA remain as an attachment instead of being integrated directly in the City agreement language. Certain sections of the MSA, including payments terms from 6.1 and termination relating to Hardware in 7.2 were integrated directly since they corresponded with sections in the City�s agreement.
 
Additional changes:
*	The City cannot accept the request for lower insurance thresholds, as our requirements are driven by the Oregon Tort Act, vendors generally use an Umbrella policy to bridge any coverage gaps
*	FLOCK  MSA to be added as Exhibit D, not directly integrated into City Agreement language
*	Exhibit B Scope � still waiting on final scope of work to be agreed upon between Flock/EPD
*	Exhibit C Compensation Schedule � awaiting final quote/scope
*

[EXTERNAL ?]
			Hi Capt Burke and Tim,
			 
			Thanks again for the time today. I am glad we are aligned on the rest of the procurement process.
			 
			To summarize, here are everyone's homework assignments:
			 
			Tim - Tim to send Caroline the City's standard T&C for review. Caroline and Tim to work through the legal review process with Flocks legal and Eugene's CA.
			 
			Captain Burke - Capt Burke to confirm with Chief if council approval is needed -  if so, ideally 2/24, 3/10, or 3/24 council date to get on agenda. Introduce Caroline to IT to confirm they have all necessary documents/questions answered. 
			 
			Caroline- 
			I have attached Flock's legal documents for your attorney's review:
			*	Order Form Exhibit A. This document outlines the products, payment terms, subscription term length, etc. This is the doc that will eventually be signed. We will update the term length and # of products as Caroline and Capt Burke finalize the deployment map.
			*	Exhibit B- Master Services Agreement (MSA). This is terms and conditions that will need to be approved by your attorney. Flock's legal team is easy to work with on comments/redlines, but they do request that all comments are made via Microsoft Word Track Changes.
			*	Exhibit C - Customer Implementation Guide. This is the guide to installation, no review of signatures needed on this
			Thank you again! Please don't hesitate to give me a shout at any time.
